briefdescription.para: Resets border properties to default values.
Determines whether the specified border is equal in value to the current border.
Determines whether the specified object is equal in value to the current object.
Gets or sets the border color.
Gets or sets distance of the border from text or from the page edge in points.
Returns true if the LineStyle is not LineStyle.None.
Gets or sets the border style.

detaileddescription.para: If you set line style to none, then line width is automatically changed to zero.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the border width in points.

detaileddescription.para: If you set line width greater than zero when line style is none, the line style is automatically changed to single line.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the border has a shadow.

detaileddescription.para: In Microsoft Word, for a border to have a shadow, the borders on all four sides (left, top, right and bottom) should be of the same type, width, color and all should have the Shadow property set to true.

briefdescription.para: Serves as a hash function for this type.
Represents a border of an object.

detaileddescription.para: Borders can be applied to various document elements including paragraph, run of text inside a paragraph or a table cell.
